intro: Eurya leptophylla var. tsushanensis, commonly known as the Tsushan eurya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Yunnan and Sichuan provinces. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often densely packed on the stems. It produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by bright red berries in the fall. This evergreen shrub thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest environments.
